main.name: Jeff Xiang
main.headline: Jeff Xiang
main.bio: After graduating from UC Berkeley with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, I became a full-time software engineer at Pinterest. I work on building hyper-scalable, real-time logging and data ingestion infrastructure that powers Pinterest. Outside of work, I enjoy playing basketball, discovering new music, and learning how to DJ.

work.title: Software Engineer, Logging Platform
work.description: Build planet-scale, real-time logging & data ingestion infrastructure. Maintain 3000+ AWS EC2 instances running distributed data systems, such as Apache Kafka. Improve cross-region data mirroring stability and reliability, reducing related incidents by 80% year over year.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern, Logging Platform
work.description: Designed and implemented real-time visualization and monitoring system for Pinterest's data ingestion pipeline, enabling higher visibility of data flows across >10000 pipeline components and improving time-to-detection of critical pipeline issues by more than 60x.

work.title: Quantitative Research Intern
work.description: Designed and implemented a deep learning neural network for predicting high frequency financial asset returns (â‰¥ 85% validation accuracy). Created a real-time financial data collection program and trading simulator for training and evaluating predictive model.

work.title: Developer
work.description: Conducted data-driven analysis to improve UC Berkeley's data science course design. Designed lab assignments for introductory data science connector course focused on sports analytics.

projects.title: C Compilter and MIPS CPU Simulator

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
